meanings.definition: One of a series of short vertical posts, often ornamental, used to support a railing.
meanings.sent1: The baluster on the porch was painted white.
meanings.sent2: Hold onto the baluster as you walk up the stairs.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to climb the baluster like a tree.
meanings.sent4: The baluster stood tall and proud, like a soldier on duty.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the baluster added elegance to the staircase.

meanings.definition: A molded shaft, square or circular, in stone or wood, that supports the handrail of a staircase.
meanings.sent1: The wooden baluster was smooth to the touch.
meanings.sent2: The staircase was lined with beautifully carved balusters.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel mistook the baluster for a nut and tried to bury it.
meanings.sent4: The baluster held up the handrail with unwavering strength.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight glinted off the polished surface of the baluster.
